image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: A coroner has called for SA Police to change its operating practices after a "high need detainee requiring medical attention" deteriorated while he was left alone in his cell for 41 minutes, after officers decided he needed an ambulance.

title.children: Detainee left alone in cell suffers cardiac arrest waiting for ambulance

image.altText: Elon Musk stands in front of a screen and waves.

props.synopsis: A proposal to build a Tesla factory in Adelaide's south is one step closer, despite 95 per cent of respondents to the local council's public consultation opposing the plan.

title.children: Council progresses plan for Tesla battery factory, despite 'anti-Elon' sentiment

image.altText: A woman in a hooded jacket covers her face after a court appearance.

props.synopsis: A manslaughter charge has been dropped against a South Australian woman over the death of her six-year-old daughter. Instead, she has pleaded guilty to three charges of criminal neglect. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains the first name and image of a person who has died.

title.children: SA mother pleads guilty to criminal neglect over death of 6yo daughter

image.altText: A drone picture of Adelaide's Sam Way building, with other CBD buildings nearby.

props.synopsis: A former senior member of a South Australian church has been jailed and told he "should've known better" when he sexually assaulted a 14-year-old girl in the early 2000s.

title.children: 'Should've known better': Former senior church member sentenced for teen sex assault

image.altText: A man surrounded by emergency service workers holding a blanket and plastic bags.

props.synopsis: Emergency services have rescued a man from the bottom of a deep cave in the centre of a regional South Australian city.

title.children: Man pulled to safety after getting stuck in 30m deep sinkhole

image.altText: Man with black hat and grey shirt with arm around a brown pony as it eats from a bucket.

props.synopsis: South Australian farmers say "there's no hay" in the state, and where it is available, it has reached unsustainable prices amid ongoing drought conditions.

title.children: 'No hay' in South Australia casting doubt over farming future

image.altText: Council crews in high vis clothing shovel fallen debris into the back of a truck

props.synopsis: Thousands of South Australian households and businesses have been without power this morning as the clean-up continues after gusty winds, high rainfalls and high tides that hit most of the state yesterday.

title.children: Thousands lose power as SA cleans up after damaging storm

image.altText: Charlotte Walker smiles as she sits wearing a black blazer

props.synopsis: South Australia's Charlotte Walker has become the nation's youngest senator, snaring the state's sixth upper house seat at just 21, and says she hopes to bring 'a different perspective' to the Labor Party.

title.children: At just 21, Charlotte Walker is Australia's youngest senator

image.altText: Richard Boyle speaks to supporters outside court.

props.synopsis: Australian Taxation Office (ATO) whistleblower Richard Boyle has pleaded guilty to four charges including taping private conversations without consent.

title.children: ATO whistleblower Richard Boyle pleads guilty to four charges

image.altText: A woman holding fabric shopping bags while others are on a rack and on hooks

props.synopsis: Jody McKechnie's concerns about plastic use spurred her to start the 10,000 Bag Project. With the help of the local community she has achieved her goal.

title.children: Volunteer makes 10,000 free fabric shopping bags to fight waste

image.altText: A blond man and blonde woman stand shoulder-to-shoulder as they pose for photos

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says Todd and Julie Chrisley were dealt "a pretty harsh treatment" after being found guilty of tax evasion and bank fraud.

title.children: Trump to pardon reality stars who conspired to defraud banks of more than $30m

image.altText: A man looks to up, to the side and out of frame with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Richard Boyle has faced the heavy price of being a whistleblower in Australia. It's time for urgent reforms of public and private sector whistleblower laws and the establishment of a new body to protect those who blow the whistle.

title.children: 'Richard Boyle is a superhero': So why didn't whistleblower laws protect him?

image.altText: Houses in Brisbane street

props.synopsis: Australians forked out more than $24.2 billion on home construction in the latest three-month reporting period, but experts warn building activity must significantly escalate to meet the federal government's goal to build 1.2 million homes by 2029.

title.children: Housing targets need 40 per cent uplift, experts warn

image.altText: A boy holds up a jar on the back of a truck

props.synopsis: A newly registered American private security contractor backed by a new charity that rights groups want investigated is now responsible for delivering food to the 2.1 million people in Gaza under a plan similar to earlier Israeli proposals to sidestep longstanding international aid arrangements.

title.children: The mysterious new contractor distributing aid in Gaza

image.altText: US bank notes pictured on a black background

props.synopsis: It is a threat to Australian borrowers on fixed-interest mortgages, and a concern for anyone with exposure to US assets, including through superannuation.

title.children: 'Panic' as dive in US dollar risks Australia's $4 trillion super pool

image.altText: Identical twins Danny and Michael Philippou pose for a photo, making funny faces in front of a neutral background.

props.synopsis: Aussie directors Danny and Michael Philippou are behind the $143 million smash-hit Talk to Me, but they won't be switching Adelaide for Hollywood. Now they're back with a gory new feature, once again exploring the horrors of teen life in suburbia.

title.children: Why Aussie directors behind $143m smash-hit won't be moving to Hollywood

image.altText: Fans of Argentine soccer legend Diego Armando Maradona hold a banner that reads ''Justice for God''

props.synopsis: The future of the trial is now in doubt as one of the three presiding judges has stepped down from the case amid accusations of ethical breaches.

title.children: Maradona asked for alcohol and hamburgers after brain surgery, court hears

image.altText: An aerial shot of the Gnarapub beach front.

props.synopsis: A luxury five-star resort has the go-ahead from the Environmental Protection Authority in WA's South West, disappointing nearby residents who have fought the project for years.

title.children: Controversial plans for $138m Margaret River resort green-lit by EPA

image.altText: A red dot over an area south-west of Sydney and north-west of Wollongong.

props.synopsis: Geoscience Australia says the earthquake was relatively small but was strong enough to be felt throughout the Wollondilly Shire.

title.children: Shallow magnitude 3.5 earthquake recorded south-west of Sydney

image.altText: Gareth Ward arrives at court

props.synopsis: One of the alleged victims of former NSW Cabinet Minister Gareth Ward tells a court the politician raped him in his Sydney home after he repeatedly declined his advances.

title.children: Trial hears man refused NSW MP's sexual advances before alleged rape

image.altText: A rocket takes off leaving behind a thick plume of smoke

props.synopsis: The two-stage spacecraft, consisting of the Starship vessel mounted atop a towering SpaceX Super Heavy rocket booster, blasted off at about 7:36pm local time on Tuesday in Texas.

title.children: SpaceX Starship launches after two failures but tumbles out of control

image.altText: Sophia Rose running

props.synopsis: A community is trying to process the alleged murder of three-year-old girl Sophia by her mother, remembering a "beautiful little girl" who would bring joy to everyone she met.

title.children: Moore Park Beach reeling from alleged murder of 3yo girl by mother

image.altText: GettyImages-2210001671

props.synopsis: The Bombers pick two talls in the AFL's mid-season draft as they look to make a run at the finals.

title.children: Bombers pick two talls at mid-season draft as Eagles claim Richmond VFL gun

image.altText: Elisabeth Moss as June holding a baby, foreheads pressed together, Moss smiling

props.synopsis: Fans of the Handmaid's Tale have taken to social media to express their gratitude, and anger, at the show's creators following the series finale.

title.children: Social media reaction to the Handmaid's Tale finale

image.altText: A white bus on its side surrounded by emergency services personnel in high vis.

props.synopsis: A truck driver has been acquitted on seven counts of dangerous driving causing serious injury, over a crash two years ago in Melbourne's west that left several primary school children with traumatic injuries.

title.children: Truck driver found not guilty over Eynesbury school bus crash

image.altText: Main entrance to Newington College on stanmore road in stanmore in sydney's inner west

props.synopsis: The Supreme Court says a 162-year-old school originally for male students in Sydney's inner west can now accept females, following backlash from some alumni.

title.children: Court stops bid to keep Sydney private school for male students only

image.altText: Two women holding an indigenous Australian flag that is printed with the word 'WELCOME'.

props.synopsis: A motion calling on a Tasmanian council to dispense with Welcome to Country and Acknowledgement of Country protocols at events has been rejected — but the "damage has been done", the mayor says.

title.children: Move to end Welcome to Country protocols at council rejected

image.altText: Girl in yellow dress holds a rock with a love heart drawn on it.

props.synopsis: Six senior doctors have told an inquest of system failures in the care of Pippa White which led to the undetected progression of sepsis and pneumonia that killed the two-year-old.

title.children: Six senior medical experts say toddler's sepsis death 'avoidable'

image.altText: Vladimir Putin chairs a meeting in the Kremlin wearing a black suit

props.synopsis: US president President Donald has become increasingly frustrated with his Russian counterpart over his actions in Ukraine, lashing out at him for the second time this week.

title.children: Trump warns Putin he is 'playing with fire' over Ukraine

image.altText: AFL player Adam Selwood tries to handball while being tackled.

props.synopsis: A large group of mourners began gathering at West Coast Eagles headquarters just after midday on Wednesday, to farewell one of the club's favourite sons.

title.children: AFL greats gather to farewell Adam Selwood at memorial service

image.altText: RBA building

props.synopsis: Consumer prices rose 2.4 per cent for the year to April, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics. It is the third month in a row that headline inflation rate has remained steady.

title.children: Odds remain on July rate cut as inflation stays on target

image.altText: John Pesutto and Moira Deeming in a composite image.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal premier Jeff Kennett is among three former Victorian Liberal leaders named in a legal letter from MP Moira Deeming about recovering legal costs from John Pesutto's financial backers.

title.children: Former premier Jeff Kennett blasts Moira Deeming for 'destructive' letter

image.altText: A blurry video screenshot shows a woman on the ground surrounded by several people and a man on the phone

props.synopsis: A violent assault in Sydney's east has sparked a 27,000-strong petition demanding tougher youth crime laws.

title.children: 'Deep anger and anxiety': Chinese community react to spate of alleged attacks

image.altText: Men in 1900s clothes surround a pile of rubble.

props.synopsis: A New South Wales coal mine where 96 men and boys died in an explosion 123 years ago is heritage listed, 14 years after the initial application.

title.children: Heritage listing of Australia's deadliest mine disaster site a 'bit late'
